item.title: Go for desktop tools over Python
item.description:
So for some time I have primarily used Python as my language of choice for most projects, and for my own desktop tools. Python is a very powerful choice for server-side solutions, and can definitely be used for desktop tools but does offer some problems.

Inevitably, Python solutions require Python modules. If your OS packages them then maybe you can use the native packaging solution to install them, but I often find that this is not the case. I don’t like to install modules globally outside of the packaging system, so I end up making liberal use of virtualenvs, but then it gets worse when you need a specific Python version.
